body_html: It's pretty much what it says: when you construct the cells, every next cell's input must have the same size as the previous cell's output. Unless it's changed recently, BasicLSTMCell makes the input size and the hidden size = output size the same. So it can't be used for what you're trying to do. If you're using that, take a look at LSTMCell instead, where you can specify the sizes separately.

body: It's pretty much what it says: when you construct the cells, every next cell's input must have the same size as the previous cell's output. Unless it's changed recently, BasicLSTMCell makes the input size and the hidden size = output size the same. So it can't be used for what you're trying to do. If you're using that, take a look at LSTMCell instead, where you can specify the sizes separately.
